Author: André Lage
Description: This sample demonstrates how to use a Location column to display details and a Map from Bing.

Name: location-weather
Title: Display Location Weather Details
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample utilizes sub properties of a Location column to build an image that pulls weather from WeatherForYou.com

Name: managed-metadata-button
Title: Managed Metadata Values to Buttons
Author: Daniel Giessenburg
Description: This sample demonstrates changing managed metadata (multiple) values to buttons that open (external) sites, documents or items on other links.

Name: managed-metadata-tag
Title: Display Tags
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates changing managed metadata values to tag-like appearance.

Name: managed-metadata-tag-icon
Title: Managed Metadata Tag Icon
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample displays a tag icon to the left of the value in the managed metadata column.

Name: multi-choice-color-circles
Title: Color Circles
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a circle of the color of the value of the choices.

Name: multi-choice-country-flags
Title: Multiple Choice Country Flags
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying flags of the counties selected in the multiple selection SharePoint choice column.

Name: multi-choice-foreach
Title: Multi-Choice forEach
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates usage of the forEach property to create template elements applied to each choice in a multi-select choice field.

Name: multi-choice-icons
Title: Multi-Choice Icons
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates using the indexOf and join functions (O365 only) to test if a multi-select choice field has a selected choice. Providing icons of the known choices and applying themed colors based on if the given choice is selected or not creates an intuitive, easy to understand visualization that doesn't suffer from varying item order or text formatting issues.

Name: multi-choice-links
Title: Multi-Choice Links
Author: Anoop Tatti|Abhijeet Jadhav
Description: This sample shows how we can display multiple links in a single column using the multi-choice column.

Name: multi-choice-list
Title: Bulleted and Numbered List
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying Multi-Select Choice column values like a bulleted and numbered list.

Name: multi-choice-thumbnail
Title: Multiple thumbnail
Author: Federico Sapia
Description: This tutorial will help you create a multiple thumbnail through images URLs listed in a multiple choice column.

Name: multi-choice-workcategory-pill
Title: Work Progress Category Pill
Author: Ganesh Sanap|Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This JSON sample demonstrates how you can format the work progress category choices as pills found in the newly released Microsoft Lists Work progress tracker template.

Name: multi-lookup-projected-field
Title: Multi-lookup fields and projected fields
Author: Chris Kent|Tim Hunt
Description: Lookup columns that support multiple values can be formatted using the advanced `forEach` property. Unfortunately, the way values are returned for any projected fields (additional columns associated to your lookup column) can present unique challenges. This sample provides two formats illustrating the difference in how these columns are formatted.

Name: multi-person-currentuser
Title: Highlight the Current User (Using a Multi-Person Column)
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample uses the @me keyword to check if the person field contains the current user and shows that entry using a different color and weight. This is a dynamic check that will always highlight the user using the list (not the creater of the format). This template could easily be extended to apply different/additional styles or icons as desired by simply copying the same expression logic for other fields.

Name: multi-person-facepile
Title: Multi-Person Facepile
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample provides rounded images for each person in a multi-select person field.

Name: multi-person-favorite
Title: Multi person favorite
Author: Alexander Henkel
Description: Mark a list item as a favorite

Name: multi-person-inlineedit-pill
Title: Multi-Person inline edit pill
Author: Hubert Lam
Description: This sample provides a pill style for each person in a multi-select person field, whilst allowing inline edits.

Name: multi-person-mailto
Title: Multi-Person Mail To Link
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This column formatting sample demonstrates how to add a mailto: link for each person in a multiple selection person column.

Name: multi-person-reaction
Title: Reacting and displaying users who have reacted
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to react and display users who have reacted.

Name: multi-person-teams-chat-link
Title: Multi-Person Teams Chat Link
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates creating a deep link to a Microsoft Teams chat. This format works both within Microsoft Teams and within SharePoint Online.

Name: multi-person-unique-reaction
Title: Like / Dislike - Unique reaction
Author: Michel Mendes
Description: This sample provides rounded images for each person in a multi-select person field.

Name: number-abs-tolerance-comparison
Title: Tolerance Comparison
Author: David Warner II
Description: Display if a value is within the expected tolerance.

Name: number-background-color-shading
Title: Shaded Backgrounds
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the shade of the background color according to the value of the number column.

Name: number-battery
Title: Number Battery
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample changes the appearance of the values in number columns (percent)  to look like a battery.

Name: number-circle-in-circle
Title: Number Circle in Circle
Author: Geert de Kooter
Description: This sample shows how the percentage value in a column can be displayed as the area of a circle within another circle.

Name: number-conditional-format
Title: Minimum Value Highlight
Author: Vesa Juvonen
Description: This example uses the conditional operator ? to apply a class (sp-field-severity--warning) to the parent div element when the value in the current field is less than or equal to 70. This causes the field to be highlighted when the value is less than or equal to 70, and appear normally if it's greater than 70.

Name: number-conditional-progress-color
Title: Conditional Progress Color
Author: Ari Gunawan
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying progress bar with conditional color based on the value.

Name: number-countup-countdown
Title: Display Count Up and Count Down Buttons
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates a button with a number increasing by one and a button with a number decreasing by one.

Name: number-data-bar
Title: Data Bar
Author: Vesa Juvonen|Chris Kent
Description: These formats apply background-color and border-top styles to create a data bar visualization of @currentField, which is a number field. These styles are applied using the special column formatting class sp-field-dataBars. The bars are sized differently for different values based on the way the width attribute of the main div is set.

Name: number-data-bar-multi-color
Title: Multi-Colored Databars
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This column formatting sample demonstrates how to show the number column as data bars with multiple colors.

Name: number-data-plant
Title: Format a column with multi-path SVGs
Author: Luise Freese
Description: This formats applies different SVGs with multiple paths to a number field, depending on the value of the field.

Name: number-decimal-binary
Title: Decimal to Binary Conversion
Author: André Lage
Description: This sample provides decimal conversion to binary using standard List formatting math functions.

Name: number-doughnut-chart
Title: Doughnut Chart
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: Changes the appearance of the values in number columns (percent) to a donut chart.

Name: number-emoji-progressbar
Title: Progress bar using text or emoji
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the use of text symbols and emoji to display a progress bar.

Name: number-gauge
Title: Number Gauge
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates combining a fixed SVG (gauge background) with a dynamic SVG (needle). It makes understanding number columns (percent) very intuitive.

Name: number-gradation
Title: Number Gradation
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates a gradual background color change between the minimum and maximum values.

Name: number-heart-in-heart
Title: Heart in Heart
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the size of a heart by using the percent value of a numeric column.

Name: number-heart-shading
Title: Heart Shading
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to express percentages in terms of the color shading of a heart displayed in SVG.

Name: number-icon-progressbar
Title: Icon Progress Bar
Author: Julien Seguin
Description: This sample demonstrates creating a progress bar using icons. The number column represents the stage in a process and the format provides a visual indicator of where an item is in relation to the process by showing the previous steps as completed, highlighting the current step, and indicating which steps remain.

Name: number-icon-repeat
Title: Display icons by repeating
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the use of the padStart and split operators to repeatedly display icons for the number of values in the number column.

Name: number-level-bar
Title: Number Level Bar
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a percentage across a bar. End users are able to edit the values by increasing/decreasing in 25% increments using arrow buttons.

Name: number-linear-gauge
Title: Linear Gauge
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a linear gauge from a regular string set to the split operator.

Name: number-localization
Title: Number Localization
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates changing text output based on the @lcid token. This allows you to provide localized text within your format ensuring that users in various regions can use your formats without issue.

Name: number-per-100-people-grid
Title: Per 100 People Grid
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a grid of 100 dots where dots are colored based on how many of something per 100 people.

Name: number-piechart
Title: Pie Chart
Author: Aaron Miao|Chris Kent
Description: This example renders whole pie in neutralLight with radius 50 and the number% (column value) as a slice of the pie in blue using `<svg>` with `<path>` tags. The number% displayed at the bottom of the pie in neutralPrimary.

Name: number-quiz-smiley-face
Title: Quiz Results with Emoji
Author: Matt Maher
Description: This allows teachers to show smiley faces next to quiz results similar to how they do it on paper. The number (based on a 0-100 score) will indicate if its a smiley or frown, which come from the Offie UI Fabric Icon set. If the number is above 90 the student gets a super smiley (`Emoji`), above 75 regular smile (`Emoji2`), above 60 neutral smiley (`EmojiNeutral`), below 60 a frown (`EmojiDisappointed`), and anything else gets an `Unknown`.

Name: number-star-rating
Title: Star Rating
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates changing the value of a number column to a star rating.

Name: number-trending-icon
Title: Show trending up/trending down icons
Author: Vesa Juvonen|David Warner II
Description: These formats rely on two number fields, Before and After, for which the values can be compared. They show the appropriate trending icon next to the value of the After field, depending on that field's value compared to the value in Before. The sp-field-trending--up class is used when After's value is higher; the sp-field-trending--down class is used when After's value is lower. No icon is shown when they are equal (padding is added to keep consistent alignment).

Name: number-version-publish-status
Title: Publishing Status
Author: Paul Bullock
Description: Sample contains an example of using the modulo math expression for highlighting 'published', 'published with draft' and 'draft with no published versions' of pages

Name: number-volume
Title: Volume option
Author: André Lage
Description: This sample includes visual selection of volume from 0 to 5.

Name: number-zero-to-ten-rating
Title: 0 to 10 Rating Scale
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the use of the split operator to change the value of a number column to the appearance of a 0 to 10 rating scale.

Name: person-assign-to-me
Title: Assign to Me
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the use of the setValue action of customRowAction to set the current logged-in user in the Person column.

Name: person-currentuser
Title: Highlight the Current User
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample uses the @me keyword to check if the person field is the current user and shows that person using a different color and weight. This is a dynamic check that will always highlight the user using the list (not the creater of the format). This template could easily be extended to apply different/additional styles or icons as desired by simply copying the same expression logic for other fields.

Name: person-hover-card
Title: Person Hover Card
Author: Niket Jain
Description: The following image shows a list with a default hover added to a formatted column in a list

Name: person-localization
Title: Person Localization
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates changing text output based on the @lcid token. This allows you to provide localized text within your format ensuring that users in various regions can use your formats without issue.

Name: person-mailto
Title: Person Mail To Link
Author: Vesa Juvonen
Description: You can use column formatting to render quick action links next to fields. This sample, intended for a person field, renders two elements inside the parent `<div />` element:

Name: person-name-avatar
Title: People Name Avatar Card
Author: Sai Bandaru
Description: This SharePoint column formatting sample provides a modern, interactive People card for list items using JSON formatting.

Name: person-roundimage-format
Title: Display a Person's Profile Picture in a Circle
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample applies styles to a parent div element and a child img element to show a person's profile picture in a circle.

Name: person-teams-call-format
Title: Teams Call Format
Author: André Lage
Description: This sample uses Microsoft Teams deep links to create links from selected user that allow to make Microsoft Teams calls to user.

Name: person-teams-message-format
Title: Teams Message Format
Author: Steve Corey
Description: This sample is using Microsoft Teams deep links to create a link that allows a user to send Microsoft Teams messages to the user in the column.

Name: picture-roundimage-format
Title: Display a Picture Column in a Circle
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample applies styles to a parent div element and a child img element to show a picture column in a circle.

Name: promotedstate-demote-news
Title: Demote News to Site Page
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara|Cory Schwartz
Description: This sample demonstrates how to use the setValue action to update the value of the Promoted State column to 0 and demote the news to a page.

Name: text-bing-map
Title: Display a Bing Maps Image for a Location
Author: April Dunham
Description: This template uses Bing Maps staticmap API which generates an image using a parameterized URL. The template only uses the most basic features of map location and image size. To see all of the available option see the static map documentation

Name: text-comma-separated-value-tags
Title: Display Comma-Separated Text as Tags
Author: Sudhir Kesharwani
Description: This sample demonstrates using the split function to display a comma separated text as tags.

Name: text-conditional-format
Title: Conditional Text Formatting (Severity)
Author: Lincoln DeMaris
Description: You can apply conditional formatting to text or choice fields that might contain a fixed set of values. This sample applies different classes depending on whether the value of the field is Done, In Review, Blocked, or another value.

Name: text-contains
Title: Text Contains
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates using the indexOf function (O365 only) to test if text contains a given value. The sample also uses the toLowerCase function to ensure the contains condition is case-insensitive. In this sample, if the text of the current field contains the word 'dead' a class is applied to turn the text red.

Name: text-course-registration
Title: Course Registration
Author: Dennis|Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates creating a button to register for a course.

Name: text-expand-collapse-format
Title: Expand Collapse Format
Author: André Lage
Description: Demonstrates creating a button to register for a course.

Name: text-googlemaps-link
Title: Display Link to Google Maps
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a link to Google Maps. When you open that link, a map of the area around the field value location is displayed.

Name: text-hyperlink-long-addresses
Title: Hyperlink long addresses
Author: Geert de Kooter
Description: The URL in a hyperlink column has a 255-character limit, which can get you into trouble. This sample demonstrates the use of a multiple lines of text column to display the link so that this limitation can be avoided.

Name: text-isbn-image
Title: ISBN to Book Cover Image
Author: Aaron Miao
Description: This example retrieves book cover images based on their ISBN numbers by utilizing the Open Library Covers API. The API works by building a cover image URL with the ISBN.

Name: text-local-image
Title: Reference a Local Image
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample provides multiple formats to illustrate the options available to reference local image files. The primary purpose is to demonstrate the usage of `@currentWeb` (O365 only) to prevent issues with reusable formats or formats rendered outside of the main list view.

Name: text-local-link
Title: Linking to a Local Resource
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample provides multiple formats to illustrate the options available to link to local resources. The primary purpose is to demonstrate the usage of `@currentWeb` (O365 only) to prevent issues with reusable formats or formats rendered outside of the main list view. This format links to other lists, but this could just as easily be specific pages/files/etc. on a site.

Name: text-multiple-hyperlinks
Title: Multiple hyperlinks in single field
Author: Geert de Kooter
Description: Using this sample you can have multiple hyperlinks in a single field.

Name: text-phonenumber-teams-call
Title: Call phone number with Microsoft Teams
Author: Hagen Deike
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a phone number stored in a single line of text column as a link to initiate a Microsoft Teams call.

Name: text-qrcode
Title: Display QR Code
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the use of TEC-IT's service to convert column value text into a QR code and display it.

Name: text-ryg-status-indicator
Title: Traffic Light (Red-Yellow-Green) Status Indicator
Author: Travis Lingenfelder
Description: This sample displays a traffic light style (Red-Yellow-Green) status indicator based on the value of a choice/text column (to use a lookup column, switch all occurrences of `@currentField` to `@currentField.lookupValue`).

Name: text-startswith-callingcodes
Title: Text StartsWith Calling Codes
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates using the indexOf function (O365 only) to test if text starts with a given value. Using the international calling code at the start of a phone number, the correct country's flag is shown next to the phone number. The same nested conditionals are also used for the tooltip.

Name: text-strikethrough
Title: Strikethrough on Completion
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Classic task lists add a strikethrough style to the task name when the task is marked as completed. This sample shows how to achieve this in a modern list view.

Name: text-wrap-format
Title: Multi-line Text with Word Wrap
Author: Aaron Miao
Description: With modern document libraries and lists, lengthy multi-line fields no longer show text in full (a fade is provided). This isn't always desired, so this sample demonstrates rending long text to mutilple lines with word wrap, similar to classic mode.

Name: yesno-checkbox
Title: Yes/No Checkbox
Author: Chris Kent|Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample uses Fluent UI icons and theme classes to provide a better visualization for Yes/No fields while respecting theme colors.

Name: yesno-checkmark
Title: Yes/No Column Check Mark
Author: Travis Lingenfelder
Description: This example displays a check mark when the value of a Yes/No column is equal to Yes. This field uses the iconName attribute to display the CheckMark Fluent UI icon.

Name: yesno-checkmark-format
Title: Yes/No Checkmark
Author: Aaron Miao
Description: You can apply conditional formatting to Yes/No fields. This sample applies different classes depending on whether the value of the field is Yes (true), No (false), or Blank. This example applies one of the column formatting predefined classes (sp-field-severity--good, sp-field-severity--low, or sp-field-severity--blocked) to the root <div /> based on the field's value. This is what determines the element's background color. A class of `ms-fontColor-neutralSecondary` is always applied to ensure the text color is legible in both light and dark themes. Then, it outputs a <span /> element with an iconName attribute that shows a Fluent UI icon inside that element.

Name: yesno-icon-color
Title: Yes/No Icon Color
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the color of the icon according to the value of the Yes/No column.

Name: yesno-roundedfill-format
Title: Rounded Fill Checkbox
Author: André Lage
Description: This sample includes custom checkbox rounded styles.

Name: yesno-toggle-format
Title: Yes/No Column Toggle
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates changing the value of the Yes/No column to a toggle. Three different versions of the sample are provided (Toggle, Icon, Emoji).
